p: The respiration rate (μL de CO 2 h −1/insect) of third-instar P. nigrispinus nymphs differed between the LD 50 and LD 90 of geranyl acetate (F 2,48 = 4.81; P < 0.001) (Fig. 2a), and of citral (F 2,48 = 22.19; P < 0.001) (Fig. 2b). The respiratory rate for third-instar P. nigrispinus nymphs differed between 1 and 3 h of exposure to geranyl acetate (F 2,48 = 5.12, P < 0.001) or citral (F 2,48 = 8.32; P < 0.001).
